tool_description: Extensive API for Football Manager 2024. Fully updated to the new database! Allows searching and filtering for every technical, mental, physical and hidden attribute, as well as numerous other stats.
name: Football Manager API
title: Football Manager API

api_list.name: Get Club Shortnames
api_list.description: Get a list of the shortnames that are used for the other /clubs endpoints. On some occasions, the names used for the /clubs endpoint may differ because the players were exported before a name change. Some examples are Manchester United which can be found by /clubs/ManUFC or Real Madrid (/clubs/R.Madrid)

api_list.name: Get players of Club
api_list.description: Get players that play for a club. Club name is the "Short Name" used in game without spaces. Examples: "Barcelona", "ManCity", "Liverpool", "PSG"

api_list.name: Get similarity of players
api_list.description: Get the similarity of the two players supplied.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://football-manager-api.p.rapidapi.com/players/similar/messi/ronaldo"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "football-manager-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://football-manager-api.p.rapidapi.com/players/similar/{firstplayer}/{secondplayer}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "football-manager-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get weighted cosine similar player
api_list.description: Get most similar based on weighted cosine similarity.

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "football-manager-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get similar player
api_list.description: Finds the player that has the most similar attributes to another player submitted in the query.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://football-manager-api.p.rapidapi.com/players/similar/kvaratskhelia"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "football-manager-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://football-manager-api.p.rapidapi.com/players/similar/{comparisonplayer}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "football-manager-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Players
api_list.description:
Filter through the Football Manager players by their age, asking Price, club, minimum CA (Current Ability, 1-200), maximum CA, minimum PA (Potential Ability, 1-200), maximum PA, name, End of Contract year, nationality, position (and secondary positions), and select the length of entries you want to receive. Specify an attribute to sort the results by in this format: "finishing-desc", "InjuryProneness-asc"

See Documentation for the filter query attributes dictionary.

api_list.name: Get player by ID
api_list.description: Get a player by his unique ID.
